sub_title: Senior Business Consultant/ Program Manager/ Product Manager/Regulatory Reporting Analyst | Freelancer | EMIR| MIFID| SFTR | HKMA | FINSA | Financial Markets | Derivatives | Pricing
summary:
Over 13 years of experience as a Business Analyst/ Functional Analyst/ Derivative solution Engineer/Software Developer in various Financial Institution.Strong understanding and familiarity in capital markets projects focussed on Equity Derivatives, FX Derivatives, Interest Rate Derivatives and Fixed Income businesses.
A robust engineering background with strong domain knowledge in pricing, yield curve generation, valuation using various modeling methods, market risk, VaR etc. Expertise in regulatory reporting areas viz. EMIR,MIFID2 (Markets in Financial Instruments Directive) ,MIFIR,HKMA etc..

profile_positions.title: Lead Business Analyst/Process Manager Regulatory- Financial Markets
Senior Business Consultant/ Regulatory Reporting Analyst-Financial Markets

profile_positions.description:
EMIR/DTCC Regulatory Reporting – ABN AMRO Bank N.V (Amsterdam)                              
Role: Lead Business Analyst	
Description: European Market Infrastructure Regulation (EMIR) requires banks and financial institutions to report derivative trades to DTCC as a part of its effort to enhance transparency and risk mitigation of derivatives trading. The client required Synechron to perform the requirement analysis of reporting its equity derivative trades (booked under Sophis application) to DTCC through its existing MAARS infrastructure.
Responsibilities:
Gained a complete understanding of the current Sophis implementation in the bank and DTCC requirement for equity derivatives reporting. 
Identified the coverage of products of Sophis and then mapped it under the DTCC provided product taxonomy
Identified the business events in Sophis and generated an event matrix and state chart diagram to correctly map the events to be reported to DTCC.
Understood the types of reports to be sent to DTCC for EMIR reporting.
Created the content mapping of the Sophis fields towards DTCC fields that would help Sophis in sending correct feed to MAARS and subsequently from MAARS to DTCC.
Resolved any bottlenecks while analyzing the Sophis-MAARS implementation like position level trade reporting, identifying the trade and non-trade, guide to Sophis on their feed file format and other discrepancies for Sophis towards MAARS compatibility. 
Appreciated by the client for the very well executed and timely completion of the project and identifying the critical roadblocks and resolving them.
profile_positions.title: Lead Business Analyst: Regulatory Reporting-Financial Markets

profile_positions.description:
Concerto Asset Management
Role: Lead Analyst	
Description: Concerto Asset Management, Llc (CAM) is a financial investment advisory firm headquartered in Charlotte, North Carolina. The firm manages 2 accounts totaling an estimated $110 Million of assets under management. Concerto Asset Management, Llc's. Synechron has created an application for CAM for its portfolio analysis, risk analysis and reporting.
Responsibilities:
Quickly understand and grasped the application, queries and enhancements. 
Analyzed and resolved the queries for composite builder report and net impact report.
Built the logic for the implementation of new enhancements in the reports. 
Reviewed, planned and guided the development and QA team to successfully implement the change in a timely manner.


Mubadala Capital (Abu Dhabi)
Role: Subject Matter Expert	
Description: Mubadala is a sovereign wealth fund based out of Abu Dhabi, UAE. Focused on investment and development across multiple sectors, Mubadala’s portfolio is valued at more than US $55 billion. Mubadala is an active investor in sectors and geographies that hold exciting potential and tangible returns, working in partnership with a number of world-class organizations.
Responsibilities:
Assimilated the portfolio analysis application which has positions in equity derivatives. 
Responsible for client interaction while coordinating from client site location.
Documented the functional overview of the front office, middle office and back office systems to capture the “As-Is” processes of the client.
Guided the technical team in the client site to overcome any challenge or issue faced in understanding the functional aspects of applications in various front like Front Office, Treasury, Portfolio Management etc.
profile_positions.title: Lead Business Analyst- Asset Management

profile_positions.description:
Pyxis Systems Pvt. Ltd.(London, Singapore, Pune)

1. Project: Option Maximizer
Role: Senior Analyst
Client: Prima Innotech LLC Pvt. Ltd.
Description: Option Maximizer is a web-based equity research and indicator portal, which provides client with equity / equity option related analytical details that enable the client to carry out informed buy/ sell/ hold or open/ close/ roll decisions based on trading strategies and rules implemented in the system. The project was focused on Equity Derivatives and required a great deal of understanding of the same.
Responsibilities:
Analyzed and researched risk and payoff profile of Equity Option strategies.
Defined and simulated the equity option portfolio business logic in an Excel-based tool.
Responsible for client interaction and requirement gathering
Documented overall scope, system, and functional requirement specification, which included technical analysis of stocks, options, and Excel tool for option strategies’ implicit criteria identification
Formulated a thorough analysis to describe the Equity Options module of the application.

2. Project: Citi FXLM Rates Risk (London/ Singapore)
Role: Senior Analyst
Client: Citibank
Description: Citi FXLM concerns with the development of reporting system for emerging market equity and interest rates derivatives trades. The system is used for generating risk reports for the FO and MO.
Responsibilities:
Assimilated the complete flow and architecture of the system to support the trading team, the project involved completion of tasks in demanding schedules and tight deadlines
Provided comprehensive and detailed documentations on the various modules/ aspects of the complete system that would function as a guide for the Global Support team.
profile_positions.title: Senior Analyst - Derivatives Solution/ Pricing and Valuation

profile_positions.description:
Project: Pyxis Exposure Manager
This product allows defining exposures and covers and managing them throughout their life. It assists organizations in tracking and monitoring of foreign exchange exposures and associated covers from the time of creation to their settlement.
•	Analyzed, designed and developed features for the system like Price Model (provides flexibility to the user to select a particular price model to price FX Forward and FX Option), Wash Rate (user provided rate to covert pricing result in variable currency to functional currency of an organization/country), Forward Rate Split (enables user to provide the breakup of Contract Rate into Spot, Forward Point and Margin).
•	Analyzed the functional requirement of features like Bank Margin Report (a comprehensive report that provides user the details of the margin charged by the bank), Past Performance Report (report that enables user to verify the guidelines provided by Reserve Bank of India regarding cancellation of covers), Custom Fields (controls that would enable user to add extra fields to capture information in the system).

Project: Independent Valuation Service
Independent Valuation Service is a set of extensive analytics libraries that provides fast, accurate and efficient valuation for simple and complex derivatives under various asset classes.
•	Developed the core libraries for real time and intraday valuation of FX Option, FX Spot/Forward, Interest Rate Swap and Cross Currency Swap.
•	Analyzed and implemented enhancements for the valuation and greeks calculation of inverse and cross-currency Forward and Option trades.
•	Created an excel based application for the reconcilation of the results obtained from Valuation Service.

Project: SimpliCiti
Client had a system (GMR – Global Market Risk) which was generating risk feeds daily to be sent to management group. My task was concerned with improving the performance of GMR, which involved using the risk analytics appropriately.
profile_positions.title: Engineer - Derivative Solution
